refnamediv.refpurpose: Tools to create & manage Kirby websites

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page documents briefly the &dhpackage; package.
The &dhpackage; package is a collection of shell scripts which should ease and speed the installation and management of the Kirby CMS on your machine.
It covers the process from downloading an appropriate Kirby package from Github to your local machine, installing (unpacking and copying) to a new virtual host, and eventually deinstalling it.

refsect1.title: COMMANDS
refsect1.para: The package consists of the following scripts which are documented in their own man page:

listitem.para: Script to create a user-specific configuration file which will be used by the other programs in the package. See kirbyconfigure1 for further details.
Script to delete a Kirby vhost (directory and configuration). See kirbydeinstall1 for further details.
Script to select and download a Kirby kit to the local machine. See kirbydownload1 for further details.
Script to install a Kirby kit to a new virtual host directory. See kirbyinstall1 for further details.
Script to setup a new Kirby website. This program will use kirbydownload and kirbyinstall if necessary. See kirbysetup1 for further details.
The system-wide configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;.
The per-user configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;. This file will be created by the kirbyconfigure script (see kirbyconfigure1).

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: Currently, only Kirby 3 starterkits and plainkits are supported.
The programs are currently optimized to work with the apache2 httpd.
Some functionality requires root (or sudo as root) access.
